results.title: Transfiguration
results.brief_description: Summary; A woman lying in bed thinking of her own existence and fulfilment of her life, experiences fusion of these elements in a transfiguration of thought. The images are cut in varying lengths based on part of the First Movement of Bruckner’s 9th Symphony.

results.title: Transfer of power
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Bell, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A history of the toothed wheel. This film provides a clear exposition of the historical development of the means of transferring power from the simple lever to the wheel and pulley, and finally the gear. This film has become famous throughout the world for the imaginative parallel it draws between the development of mechanisation and the general progress of industrial civilisation.

results.title: Transcribing. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”
Following through a typical series of transcribing assignments, we learn about the placing of work materials to avoid waste motion; establishing priorities so that rush items get out first; and typing techniques for faster, neater letters. Basic letter forms and procedures for transcribing from a dictating machine.

results.title: Transactional analysis
results.creator_credit: Joan D. Owens, CRM Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A training film intended to overcome managerial resistance to suggestions of the “Yes but…” variety. Based on Eric Berne’s book “Games people play” and the concept that we are made up of parent, adult and child parts of our personality.

results.title: Trans Europ Express
results.brief_description:
A film director, on the Trans Europ Express from Paris to Antwerp, decides to write a script about a sadistic drug smuggler on his way to Antwerp to collect a shipment of cocaine. There, the character gets involved with a prostitute and is caught up in a series of perilous situations. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Samy Halfon ; director, writer, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; photography, Willy Kurant.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Marie-France Pisier, Daniel Emilfork.

results.title: Trans-Canada journey
results.creator_credit: Graham Parker, Richard Gilbert and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
A jet-liner spans the miles, sheering through clouds to open sky and scenic vistas of the provinces below. Glimpses of town and country, of people of many ethnic origins, of a resourceful and industrious nation - impressions it would take days and weeks to gather at first hand - are brought to you in this vivid 1800 kilometer panorama. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.
(Awards: Montreal; Marseille; Grignasco)

results.title: Trans
results.brief_description:
A seed pod blown from a tree lands on a rural powerline. The resulting spark starts a chain reaction, and a power surge travels ‘upstream’ towards the city grid. ‘Trans’ is an interpretation of the butterfly effect, how a tiny event can help to change things on a much larger scale.
Music soundtrack by Gareth Burnell, Luke Hales and Adam Swain.

results.title: Tranquility in a wilderness: gardens of early Australia
results.creator_credit: William Fitzwater, Australian Gallery Directors Council and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: This film serves to explain the history, character and purpose of gardens during the initial 125 years of European settlement in Australia and to encourage their preservation as an integral part of our national heritage.

results.title: Tran the man
results.creator_credit: Rowan Woods, Siobhan Hannan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Ray Moss has been nicknamed “Tran” by his Asian workmates in his job as a security guard at a shopping centre in suburban Cabramatta. For Ray, the heat is on. His brother Donny and Uncle Jack have had their heroin business undercut by Asian-controlled competition in Cabramatta and Donny and Jack want Ray as their go-between. Cast features David Wenham as Ray/”Tran”.
